packageJson.name: dev-404-page
packageJson.description: Internal plugin to add a 404 page in development with helpful information
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: component-layout-creator
packageJson.description: An internal Gatsby plugin that creates pages from component files in src/layouts
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: internal-data-bridge
packageJson.description: An internal Gatsby plugin which creates data nodes from internal data
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: prod-404
packageJson.description: Internal plugin to detect various flavors of 404 pages and ensure there's a 404.html path created as well to ensure compatability with static hosts
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: query-runner
packageJson.description: Internal plugin for running queries

packageJson.name: gatsby-source-filesystem
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin which parses files within a directory for further parsing by other plugins

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-feed
packageJson.description: Creates an RSS feed for your Gatsby site.

packageJson.name: gatsby-transformer-remark
packageJson.description: Gatsby transformer plugin for Markdown using the Remark library and ecosystem

packageJson.name: gatsby-remark-images
packageJson.description: Processes images in markdown so they can be used in the production build.

packageJson.name: gatsby-remark-responsive-iframe
packageJson.description: Make iframes in Markdown processed by Remark responsive

packageJson.name: gatsby-remark-prismjs
packageJson.description: Adds syntax highlighting to code blocks at build time using PrismJS

packageJson.name: gatsby-remark-copy-linked-files
packageJson.description: Find files which are linked to from markdown and copy them to the public directory

packageJson.name: gatsby-remark-smartypants
packageJson.description: Use retext-smartypants to auto-enhance typography of markdown

packageJson.name: gatsby-transformer-sharp
packageJson.description: Gatsby transformer plugin for images using Sharp

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-sharp
packageJson.description: Wrapper of the Sharp image manipulation library for Gatsby plugins

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-google-analytics
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin to add google analytics onto a site

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-google-fonts
packageJson.description: Bring Google Fonts to Gatsby

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-sitemap
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin that automatically creates a sitemap for your site

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-offline
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin which sets up a site to be able to run offline

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-catch-links
packageJson.description: Intercepts local links from markdown and other non-react pages and does a client-side pushState to avoid the browser having to refresh the page.

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-react-helmet
packageJson.description: Manage document head data with react-helmet. Provides drop-in server rendering support for Gatsby.

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-postcss-sass
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin to handle scss/sass files with integrated support for also processing with Postcss plugins

packageJson.name: gatsby-starter-lumen
packageJson.description: Simple starter for Gatsby
packageJson.author: Alexander Shelepenok <alxshelepenok@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-page-creator
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin that automatically creates pages from React components in specified directories

description: "getDrawable()    Call Requires API Level 21  "
---


![error_image](./error.png)


*Call requires API level 21 (current min is 14): android.content.Context#getDrawable less... (F1)
This check scans through all the Android API calls in the application and warns about any calls that are not available on all versions targeted by this application (according to its minimum SDK attribute in the manifest).  If you really want to use this API and don't need to support older devices just set the minSdkVersion in your build.gradle or AndroidManifest.xml files. ... *


###      ?

 Context        ..  
  API Level 21  Device   .  
(21  ...;)  

          (?)  
 .

###     .




```JAVA
Drawable mDrawable = mContext.getDrawable(R.drawable.ic_add_black_24dp);
```

(mContext `Context`   .)  
      ,    

```JAVA
Drawable mDrawable = ContextCompat.getDrawable(mContext, R.drawable.ic_add_black_24dp);
```

`ContextCompat`     .

title: "[]   String Split,Replace"
date: "2018-07-13T00:30:32.169Z"
layout: post
draft: false
path: "/posts/android/post-6"
category: "Android"
tags:
  - "Android"
  - "Java"
  - "String"
  - "Split"
  - ""
description: "split replace .    ."
---

Java   String   `split()` `replace`  !

        .
## split() !

```JAVA
String colorPower = ":::";
String[] colorPowers = colorPower.split(":");
```

    

```JAVA
colorPowers[0] == ""
colorPowers[1] == ""
colorPowers[2] == ""
colorPowers[3] == ""
```
     .
   `split`     .


## replace()   ?

```JAVA
String colorPower = ":::";
String colorPowerReplaced = colorPower.replace(":","");
```

```JAVA
colorPowerReplaced = "";
```
       .


  (JAVA )  
"*", ".", "$", 

###         .

**
   \\\  .

```JAVA
String colorPower = "...";
String[] colorPowers = colorPower.split("\\.");
```
```JAVA
colorPowers[0] == ""
colorPowers[1] == ""
colorPowers[2] == ""
colorPowers[3] == ""
```

?

internal.content:
---
title: "[] Django REST API "
date: "2018-07-22T05:24:32.169Z"
layout: post
draft: false
path: "/posts/django/post-1"
category: "django"
tags:
  - "django"
  - "REST API"
  - "Python"
  - ""

description: "Django REST API     "
---

Django REST API    *Django REST framework*  .  
[Django REST framework Quickstart](http://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) Django tutorial     django    User, Group    .  
  Django tutorial         REST API    .  

##  
  Root  .  ~  

```
$ mkdir django-rest-tutorial  
$ cd django-rest-tutorial
```

*django*  *djangorestframework*  pip .  
```
$ pip install django  
$ pip install djangorestframework
```

  .
  *tutorial* ,  *myapp*  .

```
$ django-admin.py startproject tutorial
$ cd tutorial
$ python manage.py startapp myapp
```  

## Settings

*Django REST Framework*     
*tutorial/settings.py*    .

```python
INSTALLED_APPS = {
    #......
    'rest_framework',
    'myapp'
}

```

## Models
*first_name*  *last_name*   *Person*  model .

*myapp/models.py*

```python
from django.db import Models

class Person(models.Model):
      first_name = models.CharField(max_length=30)
      last_name = models.CharField(max_length=30)
```

## Serializers
Serializer .
*myapp/serializers.py*

```python
from myapp.models import Person
from rest_framework import serializers

class PersonSerializer(serializers.HyperlinkedModelSerializer):
    class Meta:
        model = Person
        fields = ('first_name', 'last_name')

```
## Views
View     .
*myapp/views.py*

```python
from rest_framework import viewsets
from myapp.serializers import PersonSerializer
from myapp.models import Person


class PersonViewSet(viewsets.ModelViewSet):
    queryset = Person.objects.all()
    serializer_class = PersonSerializer

```
## URLs
views  viewset Router  url   .

*tutorial/urls.py*

```python
from django.conf.urls import url, include
from rest_framework import routers
from myapp import views


router = routers.DefaultRouter()
router.register(r'persons', views.PersonViewSet)

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^', include(router.urls)),
    url(r'^api-auth/', include('rest_framework.urls', namespace='rest_framework'))
]

```

##  ...


```
python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py runserver
```

     *http://localhost:8080*     .

![hi](./run.png)


 : https://cjh5414.github.io/django-rest-framework/

/Users/paeng/dev/web/nuggy875.github.io/.rawMarkdownBody:
Django REST API    *Django REST framework*  .  
[Django REST framework Quickstart](http://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) Django tutorial     django    User, Group    .  
  Django tutorial         REST API    .  

##  
  Root  .  ~  

```
$ mkdir django-rest-tutorial  
$ cd django-rest-tutorial
```

*django*  *djangorestframework*  pip .  
```
$ pip install django  
$ pip install djangorestframework
```

  .
  *tutorial* ,  *myapp*  .

```
$ django-admin.py startproject tutorial
$ cd tutorial
$ python manage.py startapp myapp
```  

## Settings

*Django REST Framework*     
*tutorial/settings.py*    .

```python
INSTALLED_APPS = {
    #......
    'rest_framework',
    'myapp'
}

```

## Models
*first_name*  *last_name*   *Person*  model .

*myapp/models.py*

```python
from django.db import Models

class Person(models.Model):
      first_name = models.CharField(max_length=30)
      last_name = models.CharField(max_length=30)
```

## Serializers
Serializer .
*myapp/serializers.py*

```python
from myapp.models import Person
from rest_framework import serializers

class PersonSerializer(serializers.HyperlinkedModelSerializer):
    class Meta:
        model = Person
        fields = ('first_name', 'last_name')

```
## Views
View     .
*myapp/views.py*

```python
from rest_framework import viewsets
from myapp.serializers import PersonSerializer
from myapp.models import Person


class PersonViewSet(viewsets.ModelViewSet):
    queryset = Person.objects.all()
    serializer_class = PersonSerializer

```
## URLs
views  viewset Router  url   .

*tutorial/urls.py*

```python
from django.conf.urls import url, include
from rest_framework import routers
from myapp import views


router = routers.DefaultRouter()
router.register(r'persons', views.PersonViewSet)

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^', include(router.urls)),
    url(r'^api-auth/', include('rest_framework.urls', namespace='rest_framework'))
]

```

##  ...


```
python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py runserver
```

     *http://localhost:8080*     .

description: "Layout View   ?"

View     .

drawable   xml    

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<shape xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <solid
        android:color="#00000000"/>

    <corners android:radius="10dp"/>

    <stroke android:width="2dp"
        android:color="#1c626262" />


    <padding
        android:left="10dp"
        android:top="10dp"
        android:right="10dp"
        android:bottom="10dp" />
</shape>

```

       .  
drawable    xml  background  .  
   ridge_gray_round.xml  .
  
 LinearLayout        

```xml
<LinearLayout
        android:layout_width="200dp"
        android:layout_height="120dp"
        android:background="@drawable/ridge_gray_round"
        android:orientation="vertical">

</LinearLayout>

```

  

   .
